msItem.title: A collection of Anthems, ܥܢ̈ܝܢܐ , ἀντίφωνα, for the festivals of the whole year.
msItem.rubric: ܥܠ ܣ̇ܒ̣ܪܐ ܠܐ ܡ̇ܒܗܬܢܐ ܕܬܠܝܬܝܘܬܐ ܡܨ̣ܝܬ݀ ܟܠ ܗ̇ܝ ܕܐܝܬܝܗ̇ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܝܠܢ: ܡ̇ܫܪܝܢܢ ܕܢܟܬ݂ܘܒ ܥܢ̈ܝܢܐ ܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܚܘܕܪܐ ܕܟܠܗ̇ ܫ̇ܢܬܐ

msItem.title: For the Dedication of the Church
Order of the Annunciation of Zacharias
Order of the Annunciation of the Mother of God
Order of the Visit of Mary to Elisabeth.
Order of the Nativity of S. John (the Baptist)
Of the Revelation to S. Joseph by the Angel
Order of the holy Festival of the Nativity of our Lord in the flesh
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥܐܕܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܕܝܠ̣ܕܗ ܕܡܪܢ ܕܒܒܣܪ

msItem.title: Order of the Mother of God, Mary
Order of the Commemoration of the Children (the Massacre of the Innocents)
Order of the holy Festival of the Lights (τὰ φῶτα), i.e. of the Epiphany.
msItem.note: The letters ܐ, ܒ, ܓ, ܕ, ܗ, ܘ, ܙ, and ܚ, which often appear on the margins, from fol. 34 onwards, denote the different tones (ἦχοι) according to which the hymns are to be chanted.

msItem.title: Order of the Decollation of S. John (the Baptist)
Order of S. Stephen the proto-martyr
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥܠ ܣܛܦܐܢܘܣ ܣܗܕܐ ܩܕܡܝܐ ܘܪܝܫܐ ܕܣ̈ܗܕܐ

msItem.title: Order of the Entrance of our Lord into the Temple (i.e. the Presentation)
Of the holy Mār Severus the patriarch
Order of anthems for the holy Fast of the Forty (Days), i. e. Lent
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ: ܕܥܢܝ̈ܢܐ: ܕܥܠ ܨܘܡܐ: ܩܕܝܫܐ: ܕܐܪ̈ܒܥܝܢ

msItem.title: Part h.
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥܢܝ̈ܢܐ ܕܫܒܬܐ ܕܐܪ̈ܒܥ ܕܐܝܬܝܗ̇ ܡܨܥܝܬܐ ܕܨܘܡܐ

msItem.title: Order of anthems of the forty holy Martyrs (of Sebaste)
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥܢ̈ܝܢܐ ܕܥܠ ܐܪ̈ܒܥܝܢ ܣ̈ܗܕܐ ܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ

msItem.title: Order of anthems of Lazarus of Bethany
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥ̈ܢܝܢܐ ܕܥܠ ܠܥܙܪ ܕܡܢ ܒܝܬ ܥܢܝܐ

msItem.title: Order of anthems for the week preceding Palm-Sunday
For the Passion of the Redeemer
Part β. Order of the Consecration of the holy Chrism (μύρον)
Part γ. Order of the Washing (of Feet)
Part β. Order of the Adoration of the holy Cross
Order of Syrian anthems for the Resurrection, complete in eight tones
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥ̈ܢܝܢܐ ܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܩܝܡ̣ܬܐ ܕܡܫܬܡܫ ܒܬܡ̈ܢܐ ܐܟ̈ܕܝܐ
msItem.note: The term ܐܟ̈ܕܝܐ is apparently the plural of ἠχάδιον, a diminutive from ἦχος. See Dr. Payne Smith's Thesaurus, coll. 175, 176.

msItem.title: Order of the New Sunday (ἡ καινὴ or νέα κυριακή, Low Sunday), and of S. Thomas the Apostle
msItem.rubric: ܛܟ̣ܣܐ ܕܥܠ ܚܕܒܫܒܐ ܚܕܬܐ ܘܥܠ ܬܐܘ݊ܡܐ ܫܠܝܚܐ

msItem.title: Anthems for the Ascension of our Lord to Heaven
Order of the Sunday of Pentecost
Of the holy Festival of the Dedication (ἐγκαίνια) of the holy Cross
Order of the Apostles generally (Common of the Apostles)
Order of the holy Mār George
Order of the holy martyr Barbara
Order of the holy Mār Barsaumā
Syrian canons (κανόνες) of the Mother of God, and of the Saints and the Dead generally; complete in eight tones
msItem.rubric: ܩ̈ܢܘܢܐ ܣܘܪ̈ܝܝܐ ܕܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܘܕܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ ܘܕܥܢ̈ܝܕܐ ܓܘܢܐܝܬ ܕܡܫܬܡܠܐ ܒܬܡ̈ܢܐ ܐܟ̈ܕܝܐ

msItem.title: (τέταρτος) a Greek canon for the Obsequies of the Mother of God; fourth tone
msItem.rubric: ܛܟܣ̣ܐ ܕܩܢܘܢܐ ܝܘܢܝܐ ܕܥܘܦ̣ܝܗ̇ ܕܝ̇ܠܕܬ݀ ܐܠܗܐ: ܐܝܟܘܣ ܛܐܛܪܛܘܣ
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠ̣ܡ ܟܘܪܣܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܥ̈ܢܝܢܐ ܕܟܠܗ ܚ̇ܘܕܪܐ ܫ̇ܬܢܝܐ ܕܟܠܗܘܢ ܥ̈ܐܕܐ ܐܝܟ ܛܟ̈ܣܐ ܕܝܠ̣ܗܘܢ܆ ܫܘܒ̣ܚܐ ܠܐ̇ܒܐ ܘܠܒܪܐ ܘܠܪܘܚܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܗܫܐ ܘܒܟܠܙܒܢ ܠܥܠܡܝܢ ܐܡܝܢ:

msItem.title: Part of the history of the Invention of the Cross for the second time by the empress Helena.
msItem.incipit: ܬܘܒ ܟܬܒ̈ܝܢܢ ܬܫܥܝܬܐ ܕܐܝܟܢ ܕܬܫܟܚ (sic) ܩܝܣܐ ܕܨܠܝܒܐ ܕܬܪܬܝܢ ܙܒ̈ܢܝܢ. ܒܝܘܡܝ ܗܠܢܐ ܡ̇ܠܟܬܐ ܐܡ̇ܗ. ܕܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܘܣ ܡ̇ܠܟܐ ܘܕܐܝܟܢ. ܗܝܡܢ ܗܘܐ ܐܝܗܘܕܐ ܗܘ ܕܐܬܟܢܝ. ܩܘܪܝܩܘܣ ܠܦܣܩܦܐ (sic) ܠܐܘܪܫܠܝܡ܀ ܒܫܢܬ. ܬܠܬܡـ (sic) ܘܚܡ̈ܫܝܢ ܘܚܕܐ ܒܡܠܟܘܬܗ. ܕܪܚܝܡ (sic) ܐܠܗܐ ܩܘܣܛܢܛܝܢܘܣ ܏܏ܘܫ.
msItem.note: Much of this is barely legible.

collation.p: The quires, 21 in number, are signed with letters.

item.p: Leaves are wanting after foll. 144, 170, and 171.

layout.p: There are from 25 to 30 lines in each page.
In the last quire, the number of lines varies from 20 to 23.

handNote.desc: The greater part of this volume, foll. 1—180, is written in a small, neat hand of the xth cent.

See additions. The same person, apparently, has filled the remainder of fol. 189 b, as well as foll. 190 and 191a, with part of the history of the Invention of the Cross for the second time by the empress Helena.

decoNote.p: On fol. 183 b, at the foot of the page, there is a drawing of a dove.

item.p: The last quire, foll. 181—189, was added A. Gr. 1345, A.D. 1034.

On fol. 189 b there are two notes, in the same handwriting as that of the last nine leaves. The first states that this book belonged to the deacon Theodore, of the convent of Bar-Bushair, who purchased it out of his private means.

p.quote: ܡܐ= ܡܢ ܙܺܝܢܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܕܙܳܢܰܬ ܛܝܒܘܬܗ ܕܐܠܗܐ
ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܘܪܣܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܬܐܘܕܘܪܘܣ ܡܫ܏ܡܫ ܘܕܝܪܝܐ ܕܒܕܝܪܐ ܕܒܪ ܒܘܫܝܪ ܕܩܢܝ̣ܗܝ ܡܢ ܙܝܢܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܐܝܟ ܕܠܝܘܬܪܢܐ ܕܢܦܫܗ ܘܕܥ̈ܢܝܕܘܗܝ. ܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܢܨ̇ܠ̣ܐ ܥܠܘܗܝ ܘܥܠ ܥ̈ܢܝܕܘܗܝ. ܐܠܗܐ ܢܚ̇ܣ̣ܐ ܠܟܠ ܕܡ̇ܨ̣ܠܐ:

item.p: On fol. 189 b there are two notes, in the same handwriting as that of the last nine leaves. The second states that the last quire was written by the priest Jacob, A.G. 1345, A.D. 1034.

p.quote: ܚ̇ܬ݂ܡ ܟܘܪܣܐ ܗܢܐ ܐܚܪܝܐ ܝܥܩܘܒ ܩܫܝܫܐ ܫ̇ܢ̣ܬ ܐܠܦ ܘܬܠܬܡܐܐ ܘܐܪ̈ܒܥܝܢ ܘܚܡ̈ܫ ܒܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ ܝܘܡ ܫܒܬܐ. ܨ̇ܠ̣ܐ ܥܠܝܢ ܐܚܘܢ: ܡܪܝܐ ܢܚ̇ܣ̣ܐ ܠܩܲܢܝܐ ܘܠܟܬܘܒܐ ܐܡܝܢ: ܠܩ̇ܪܘ̈ܝܐ ܕܚܘܼܒܐ ܘܫܡ̈ܘܥܐ ܕܫܪܪܐ ܡܪܝܐ ܢܚܲܣܐ ܐܝܢ ܐܡܝܢ ܘܐܡܝܢ..

item.p: On fol. 189 a and b, at the top of the page, are written in a rude hand the words, "this book belongs to the priest Simon."

msItem.title: Older Syriac text
msItem.note: The lower text of this manuscript is no longer legible.

item.p: Large portions of this volume are palimpsest, but the older Syriac text is no longer legible.

handNote.desc: Older Syriac text is no longer legible.

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue. abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

langUsage.language: Unvocalized Syriac of any variety or period
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized West Syriac Script
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized East Syriac Script
